content.question: Let <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be the function given by <math alttext="f of x, equals, the fraction with numerator 1 plus, e to the x power, times sine x, and denominator e raised to the x minus 1 power, minus 1, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msup><mo>⁢</mo><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>. What are all horizontal asymptotes of the graph of <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="y equals negative 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="y equals 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>
The graph of <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> has no horizontal asymptotes.

topic.text: 1.15: Connecting Limits at Infinity and Horizontal Asymptotes

skill.text: Skill 2.D: Identify how mathematical characteristics or properties of functions are related in different representations.
